page.title: 09Local Superstitions (cont)
page.content: To cure a sore throat a sock would be placed round the neck, or the patient would be fed bread & butter which had been down a pit. Others relate to birth and death. A robin's nest built close to a house indicates a death or birth in the family. A newly born baby has to be lifted above the head, its palm crossed with silver, its clothes have to be pulled upwards over its feet, and on its first visit to a neighbour's house it's given wood matches & coal to kindle the flame of love. In the event of a death, a service is held at the house before the coffin is lifted, and the girls carry the coffin of a deceased child.
